categories.Name: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie
categories.Bio: A Nigerian writer acclaimed for her novels and talks on feminism and identity.

categories.Name: Haruki Murakami
categories.Bio: A Japanese author famous for blending magical realism with deep psychological insight.

categories.Name: George R.R. Martin
categories.Bio: Renowned for the epic fantasy series 'A Song of Ice and Fire', adapted into 'Game of Thrones'.

categories.Name: Margaret Atwood
categories.Bio: Canadian author and poet known for her speculative fiction and feminist themes.

categories.Name: Neil Gaiman
categories.Bio: A versatile author of novels, comics, and children's books, known for his fantastical storytelling.

categories.Name: J.K. Rowling
categories.Bio: British writer best known for the Harry Potter series, which became a global phenomenon.

categories.Name: Khaled Hosseini
categories.Bio: Afghan-American novelist who writes deeply moving stories about family and home.

categories.Name: Dan Brown
categories.Bio: Author of popular thrillers like 'The Da Vinci Code' that combine history, art, and puzzles.

categories.Name: James Patterson
categories.Bio: A prolific author of thrillers and mystery novels with numerous bestsellers to his name.

categories.Name: James Patterson
categories.Bio: A prolific author of thrillers and mystery novels with numerous bestsellers to his name.

categories.Name: Rushikesh thange
categories.Bio: A prolific author of thrillers and mystery books with numerous bestseller books to his name.
